Substantivoj.Noto: Putting this into a sentence turns it into a question
Refers to temperatures between 20°C and 30°C
Refers to temperatures above 40°C
Refers to temperatures between 30°C and 40°C
Refers to temperatures between 10°C and 20°C
Refers to something that can cut; does not refer to smell or figurative meanings
Both sides are inside a building
Refers to any kind of dwelling place
Refers to the concept of time (i.e. arrow of time) itself
Refers to something that one previously did not know (i.e. a new book = a book that one just obtained)
Refers to something that has not existed for too long (i.e. a new book = a book that was recently published)

Substantivoj.Signifo: subclause marker indicating the verb as the head
he, she, it, they; third-person pronoun

Substantivoj.Noto: Related to "kenid" (cold), but refers to a temperature that one would enjoy
Refers to physical weakness
Refers to sound pressure levels between 30 dB and 50 dB
Refers to the state of the sky at a given time
Refers to any of the weather conditions, such as rain, sun, etc.
Refers to temperatures between -20°C and 0°C
Refers to temperatures below -40°C
Refers to sound pressure levels between 50 dB and 70 dB
Refers to sound pressure levels between 70 dB and 100 dB
Refers to temperatures between -40°C and -20°C
Subjectively defined; refers to any temperature that is painful to endure
Refers to any instance of sound
Refers to sound pressure levels between 100 dB and 150 dB
Refers to sound pressure levels above and including 150 dB
Refers to the tool used open a lock
Refers to visible light
Refers to an abundance of light
Refers to the light emitted by fire
Refers to the concept of colours in general, not to any specific colour
Refers to physical hardness, not difficulty
Not used for apologies, which uses "lomov" instead
Refers to quietness that is peaceful
Refers to an object whose weight makes it easy to handle
Refers to an object whose weight is below what is expected
Specifically refers to the star that the Earth orbits
Refers to the astronomical objects
Refers to the falling rain itself
At least one side is outside of a building
short for "elta tol mira"
Refers to a comfortably warm temperature
Refers to the entire collection of memories that a person holds
Refers to a single remembered event
Refers to the twenty-four-hour period
Refers to the period between dawn and dusk

Substantivoj.Signifo: subclause marker indicating the first argument as the head

Substantivoj.Noto: Does not have to be covered in dirt, but anything that is undesirable

Substantivoj.Signifo: person who has lost a loved one
Substantivoj.Noto: Specifically refers to a person whose love with a siginificant other (miradre); cannot be used like the term "widow"
Refers to temperatures between 0°C and 10°C
Refers to expressions like "old news" or "old trick"

Substantivoj.Signifo: old, existed for a long time
Substantivoj.Noto: Can refer to both objects and humans

Substantivoj.Signifo: old, near the end of lifespan
Substantivoj.Noto: Can refer to both objects and humans
Refers to sound pressure levels below 30 dB
Refers to an object whose weight makes it difficult to handle
Refers to an object whose weight is above what is expected
Refers to an absence of moisture
Refers to loudness that causes discomfort
Refers to physical cleaniness; for figurative cleaniness, use "lemid" (pure)
Refers to visions seen while sleeping
Specifically refers to the residue of burning
Refers to unexpected quietness that causes anxiety
Refers to a hypothetical reality that one wishes to bring to reality
Refers to the Animalia kingdom, thus including humans
Refers to the solid state of matter
Refers to the snow itself, as opposed to the weather
antonym of vid
May refer to both adults and children
Subjectively defined; refers to a temperature that causes discomfort
Refers to loudness that is pleasant
Refers to any fine-grained particles, including ash
Used to describe something that conforms to a standard
Refers to the time of the day when dusk and dawn are equidistant; to refer to 00:00, use "trigre mika" (beginning of day) instead
Refers to the time of the day when the sun is at the zenith; to refer to 12:00, use "vogro mika" (middle of the day) instead
Refers to the ground, not the planet
Refers to any kind of indoor ground, not just wooden floor

Verboj.Noto: Does not have to refer to touching, but any sense of "getting a feeling of"
The reflexive form refers to returning or going back to the origin, which, if omitted, is presumably a place close to home or the speaker (if the speaker is not the one returning)
Refers to residing at a place
Does not refer to religion
Used to denote that the object shatters into small pieces
Specialized words exist for cutting with scissors, knife, and axe
Refers to a fine and often tedious means of creating something out of a raw material
Used to denote a person's feelings whether it's reciprocated or not
Use the reflexive form to denote "become"
Refers to either physically turning around and looking, or reflecting about the past
To denote that something is "on fire", use the reduced form "poskig"
Used to denote that the object is broken into large, usually two, pieces
Can refer to both people and things; when used on people, suggests platonic fondness
Can be used as an alternative to the volition inflection if the act of wishing itself needs a description
To say "rushed to <destination>", use "erash sibedea", which means "hastily go to"

Verboj.Signifo: fill, take up space, flood with
Verboj.Noto: Use "tenip" to denote that the filling agent is not the substance used to fill the container
Use "tenet" to denote that the substance is also the one performing the filling
Can also mean "push ... towards ..."
The slot-2 argument should be a verb in the occurrence inflection; has the same semantics as the transitive/initiation action, so it's used when the initiation itself needs a modifier
Does not imply "finish" or "complete", which is handled by "orit"
Use the reflexive inflection to indicate naturally waking oneself up

Modifantoj.Noto: Used to modify verb infinitives to indicate a repeating action that happens sometimes
Refers to ownership; stronger than "vol", which is semantically vague about the relationship
When modifying a hypothetical verb, it corresponds to "can" or "be able to"
Used to describe being within a timeframe or environment, such as "in the night", "in a week"
The following word is the name of the modified object
Used to denote the interior of a physical space
Prevents this word from accepting additional modifiers
Used to mean "something other than", which is sometimes indicated with negation in natural languages

When modifying an infinitive, indicates that the action occurs regularly; when modifying an ongoing action (either progressive or also having "tenil" attached to it), indicates that the action will not stop
Modifies a verb to indicate that it's done in order to perform another action
Modifies a stopped verb to indicate that it finished before the expected time
Followed by the number of instances of a countable noun
Modifies a hypothetical verb to indicate the obligation of doing it
Used to modify an object that lacks an association, either through ownership or characteristic, with the following object

Modifantoj.Signifo: late, near the end of a period of time

Modifantoj.Noto: Refers to an action occuring after the expected time
Links two objects without explicitly stating the nature of the relationship, which is left to the context to decide

SpecialajVortoj.Noto: Represents 1 000 000 at the start of the sequence digits; 000 000 elsewhere
Represents 100 at the start of the sequence digits; 00 elsewhere
Represents 1000 at the start of the sequence digits; 000 elsewhere

SpecialajVortoj.Signifo: he, she, it; third-person singular pronoun
